frame.name: Carry_goods
frame.definition:
<def-root>A Distributor sells, lends, or otherwise distributes a class of Goods. In the prototypical case, the Distributor is a retailer who generally keeps some type of Goods on site for the purpose of selling it to a buyer. Extensions include lending Goods (e.g., libraries, movie rental outlets), organization-internal distribution (as in a hospital), or other non-commercial distribution centers. The Goods are constrained to be a type of item (e.g., <ment>canned goods</ment>, <ment>antique dressers</ment>) rather than a particular or unique item (e.g., <ment>Smith's last self-portrait</ment>, <ment>that guitar I saw here last week</ment>). Note that a Distributor may <ment>carry</ment> some particular goods, but may not have it <ment>on hand</ment> at that exact moment.
<ex><fex name="Distributor">Trader Joe's</fex> <t>carries</t> <fex name="Goods">a wide variety of foods, drinks, and househole necessities</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Distributor
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Distributor</fen> maintains a store of <fen>Goods</fen> for the purpose of selling or otherwise distributing them.</def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Goods</fen> are kept on hand and distributed by the <fen>Distributor</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the carrying of <fen>Goods</fen> occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the storing of goods which is not covered by more specific FEs, including general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>) and salient characteristics of a <fen>Distributor</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>).</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the length of time that the <fen>Distributor</fen> carries the <fen>Goods</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: carry.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: keep a regular stock of.

lexUnit.name: stock.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have or keep a stock of
